line_1: Macheath's approv'd by all whom Tyburn awes,
line_2: And trembling guilt gives Tindal's page applause.
But with resistless force it draws,

line_1: Borne on broad wings the guilty world he awes,
line_2: And grasps the lightening in his shining claws.

line_1: Yet He that thus the Scepter awes,
line_2: Disdains not to impose his Laws

line_1: And ye, my sons, whom filial duty awes!
line_2: Ye friends, long wedded to fair Virtue's cause,

line_1: Whom conscience binds, and whom religion awes.
line_2: Chiefs, such as thou, best guard each prince's cause,
